etymology.description: Depicts the head of an ox with horns and ears
etymology.interpretation: This character pictorially represents the distinct features of an ox, emphasizing its horns and ears, which are characteristic of cattle.

examples.chinese: 牧场里的牛(牧場裡的牛)，悠闲地吃草(悠閒地吃草)。
examples.pinyin: mùchǎng lǐ de niú, yōuxián de chī cǎo.
examples.english: Oxen in the pasture graze leisurely.

examples.chinese: 那头牛(那頭牛)，正努力拉犁(正努力拉犁)。
examples.pinyin: nà tóu niú, zhèng nǔlì lā lí.
examples.english: That ox is diligently pulling a plow.
